reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I should be writing a review about the standard room that we booked for the last night of our vacation in Portugal, but upon arriving sweaty, hot, and tired after a day of sightseeing, we received the quite unexpected (and appreciated) gift of an upgrade to a luxurious 2-bedroom suite by the fabulous front desk clerk.
reviews.title: Heavenly

likes.liked: — Great location at Campo Pequeno; great value for money

reviews.text: Rooms were perfect, and the modern climate controls (which ensured a good night's sleep in a cool room) were much appreciated. The main bedroom was -- as is befitting a suite -- spacious and comfortable, and we would have enjoyed the ample closet space if we had been able to stuff a few more outfits into our overflowing backpacks.
reviews.title: Great location & Nice rooms

likes.disliked: — Wifi was not strong in my room

reviews.text: The bathroom was simply fantastic, and looked like it had been built for simultaneous use by a family of six. We certainly had no need to use the heaters or heated towel racks, but this would be a nice touch in cooler months. The bathtub was clean and -- unusually for Europe -- long enough to be perfect for six-footers.
reviews.title: Good stay

reviews.text: Alif Hotel Lisbon is certainly deserving of all the recommendations it's received on this site.
reviews.title: Great Location, hotel needs a bit more character though!

reviews.text: This is mostly an echo of other favorable reviews: Great location, very nice rooms, good views. Breakfast was OK--best part was the view from the top of the hotel. Public transportation is nearby, shopping and cinema across the street, nice architecture to admire, and good service.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: We were given a suite which was unexpected ,on the fourth floor overlooking the bullring. The bathroom was spacious with double sink, bidet etc. The breakast included scrambled egg,weiner sausage,cereals,fresh fruit, croisants,yoghurts,cakes,ham,cheeses,juices,tea or various coffees,all served in the room with wonderful views on the ninth floor.We would certainly recommend this hotel,more like a four star .Transport is easy ,once you get the hang of the metros,trams and buses.Beware of pickpockets on the metro,we were unlucky! Plenty of bouteque shops under the bull ring.Trip to Belem worthwhile,and the oceanarium was a great experience.Altogether a great few days.
reviews.title: good value hotel break

likes.liked: — spacious bedroom and bathroom,excellent breakfast included in the very reasonable price..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For 60 euros per night this is a excellent choice. We got a bigger room without asking, actually it had two rooms (bedroom + kitchen/livingroom). The room was spacious, functional, very clean and there was everything that we needed. The bathroom was huge. No minibar in the room, but a kettle was provided (and some tea bags etc.). The breakfast was good. Service at reception was efficient but not very friendly.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Pros and Cons

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -fast cheap trasfer from airport (taxi cost 6 euro including luggage)
reviews.title: good value, great base for exploring Lisbon and surroundings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Nice Simple Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent hotel, shower did not work properly (not full flow of water). But would recommend hotel. Would stay again at this hotel if in Lisbon.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel- Would recommend!

likes.liked: — Location (near metro stop), cleanliness, breakfast, staff assistance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was comfortable and very clean. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Buffet breakfast was amazing and WIDE selection of food on offer including scrambled eggs, sausages, fruit salad, toast, yoghurt, fresh fruit and variety of breads, cereals and pastries. We encountered no noise in the hotel during our stay, as we were located on the back-end of the hotel.
reviews.title: Good Location for the price

likes.liked: — location, price was great for location, cleanliness
likes.disliked: — desk staff, attitude has to go...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel conveniently located near metro stop (2 minute walk), however, walk to Marcques de Pombal (square / park) about 25 minutes. Centre of Lisbon (Rossio) 40 minute walk. From airport, less than 10 minutes drive and on a meter taxi (yellow / cream) only 7 euros (including 1.60 for luggage but no more than 10 euros!!) however a private taxi (black) may charge about 15 euros.
reviews.title: Good choice in Lisbon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was in a good location, minutes from the subway (a 3 minute walk), right across the street from the Hotel is the Praca dos Touros which has shops, restaurants, a theatre, a nice food court inside(if you want to grab something quick to eat in between touring) and suprisingly a nice grocery store specializing in products from Madeira. If you like Madeira wine, or their famouse sweet bread/food products, then that's the place to indulge. The hotel room was very clean, spacious, the TV had a few English channels i.e BBC, CNN, a sports channel, a few movie channels mainly in Portuguese, or if you got lucky had English subtitles. Breakfast was adequate. Yogurt tasted funny though, but the fruit was fresh, buffet consisted of tasty Portuguese bread rolls, a few trays of sugar-carb foods such as doughnuts, danishes filled with fruit jams or chocolate, cookies (which we avoided) but there was also warm scrambled eggs, wheat crackers, pacquets of butter,honey, phily cream cheese, jams etc, a good assortment of cereales with granola, nuts to mix, and assortment of fresh cheese. The coffee machine was mostly my saviour, which served lattes(galao -in Portuguese), cafe Americano (which is like an espresso), and they had an assortment of teas. The only peculiar food at the buffet was the "hotdogs". I read a review previously, that someone said there were hotdogs at the buffet. I thought the person meant sausages - you know, the little typical breakfast sausages. I didn't think they meant actual hotdogs (some) North Americans eat. Well, I was shocked to find they DID serve hotdogs - Schneider hotdogs. That was hillarious. Why would anyone serve such a disgusting thing for breakfast? The other downside at breakfast were the waitors. They stand around and gawk at the women as if they never seen women before. Come on, who wants to be gawked at during breakfast after seeing those whithered, smelly hotdogs they serve? Ugh...give me a break,lol. All in all, good value for money, location is great, area is reletively safe - it does get quiet at night around 11pm, you can bring children to the hotel, AC adequate but no AC in the hallways so for the drama Kings and Queens, deal with it t'll you get to your room. Also, the reception desk staff could use better customer service especially if they are giving you the wrong directions.. ie. a ferry is NOT the only way to get to the Algarve (lol), you can take a bus or a train - but the bus (evora) is the best way. Took us less than 3 hours to get to Albufeira, Algarve. Don't bother asking this hotel desk for any information, go to the subway and ask the guard there, or better yet, if you see a police officer, ask them. They are friendly, speak some English and know Lisbon by the back of their hand and will give you CORRECT directions.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in November 2007 for 2 nights, and then again later that week for one more night. Both rooms were OK. We weren't expecting luxury, nor did we need it, since we only spent a few hours there each day. Both bathrooms were a bit outdated and really small, but other than that, we had no other complaints. The hallway is lined with built-in ashtrays, which points to some heavy smoking days there - and you can smell it.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel!
